title: How to write a good preface for a book - Quora

response.answer_text: I would consider the central ideas for the book and what inspired them. Obviously you don’t want to give too much away. You want to tantalize the reader, maybe even highlighting some of the things you want to tell them in the book that aren’t directly mentioned. For instance, why did you structure the book the way you did? Maybe note certain things the reader should know before reading like symbolic use of names, etc. Never give too much away.

This is tough to answer without knowing what kind of book, and what the first chapter is lacking. The best I can say is to succinctly provide the context the reader needs to get started in chapter one.
